SENT.plain: The autogenous saphenous vein is the preferred conduit for repair of occluded arteries in the limb and coronary arteries
The aneurysmal dilatation of the vein graft is a unusual complication in the long-term period
A case of aneurysmal formation of the vein graft for the subclavian aneurysm 5 years after grafting with classic BehÃ§et disease was reported
The etiology of this rare complication and the special surgical problem were also discussed
